title: New ideas for skins and championship skins
body: Championship: Azir , ahri , graves ,fizz , rek sai , he atom , Leona.

replies.body:
Hey DMortal1, 

These all have potential to be awesome Championship skins! I'd love to see Rek'Sai in some Championship armor myself. :D 

The criteria for the skin is for the champion to be impactful during the current season, so even we don't know who we're working with until we're pretty far into the season. Keep an eye out for these guys and girls next season, and if one of them is killin' it, you could see them rise to the occasion and be the 2016 Championship skin!
i donteven like azir but wasnt him and viktor like at least 80% pick ban most games?

To give an example - Victorious Morgana was selected because Morgana, a notorious mid laner, was taken as a support, and dominated the lane. We're looking at impactful champions **in the game** more so than the champions who are banned a good percentage of the time. If you're banned, you can't exactly make the LCS big plays. :P
Morgana hasn't been a mid laner since mid season 2.

so because noone played sivir then she got played you gave her a skin? that seems like pretty bad logic imo. shouldnt you pick someone who is played a lot since that is what the season is about not just someone who was a suprise pick? i think there were a lot of better picks  for the skin this year, personally i think kallista should have gotten the skin but you gave her the championship skin. which makes sense because i dont think people would pay money for a championship sivir.

When we'd [hinted](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/3ci34o/were_not_selling_the_victorious_skin/) towards the Victorious skin being a marksman, the top player picks included Sivir. This isn't the reason we'd selected her, as I've mentioned the criteria we use above, but it was clear Sivir was someone players felt was impactful.

Dont take this the wrong way, but clearly from peoples responses to the victorious skin being sivir i think we'll have to disagree. i understand you wanted a marksman i get the logic there you wanted to fill out the victorious pool to have champs from multiple roles, now im assuming you are talking about most impactful in the lcs NOT in the season (that skin would go to vayne), so i guess i see how you would choose sivir but i still think kallista trist or vayne deserved the skin a lot more. on a seperate note did riot ever decide what  they were going to do chroma wise with these skins?

No, that skin would not at all go to Vayne. That's literally the same problem as choosing Sivir. Vayne in solo-queue didn't see any play for months and now is at a high point. Sivir in solo-queue was at a highpoint and hasn't season play in a few months. Sivir just also has the benefit of being the definition of the tank meta, whereas Vayne...didn't really change anything about the game.

Trist was highly impactful in the NA LCS, but the others kinda meh, not to mention she didn't really change the meta at the level Sivir did.

Vayne didnt see play for months? what? Vaynes been played all season long, shes been the most popular solo que adc pick. sivir opened a new style to play that got played for a short while only in lcs and hasnt been played much since. my point is at least champs like trist and vayne have been impactful in both lcs and solo que, whereas sivir was impactful for about a month or two in lcs.

Keep an eye out for these guys and girls next season, and if one of them is killin' it, you could see them rise to the occasion and be the 2016 Championship skin!

That still doesn't explain Championship Shyvana, though.  Shyvana was only "impactful" for a few weeks during Season 4 before she fell off for other champs.  Could have just as easily been Champ Trundle...

In order to create the Championship/Victorious skin, we need to plan in advance to get the concept, model, etc created and ready to roll by the end of the season/Worlds. Unfortunately, that means picking a champion a bit earlier in the season, as opposed to the end. 

We realize that Shyvana wasn't impactful throughout the entire season, but she still had a significant impact at the beginning of the season.

> [{quoted}](name=Riot KateyKhaos,realm=NA,application-id=A8FQeEA8,discussion-id=cEUNgXWE,comment-id=000100020000,timestamp=2015-10-05T20:27:57.227+0000)
>
> In order to create the Championship/Victorious skin, we need to plan in advance to get the concept, model, etc created and ready to roll by the end of the season/Worlds. Unfortunately, that means picking a champion a bit earlier in the season, as opposed to the end. 
> 
> We realize that Shyvana wasn't impactful throughout the entire season, but she still had a significant impact at the beginning of the season.

I'm sorry, I really am, but are you're telling me that it takes the Riot skin team at least _nine months_ to choose and create the Championship skin, and the decision is only based on a few weeks worth of gameplay?

If that's the case (and I have no reason to doubt that it is), I would have to commend the team's luck in successfully guessing the relevance of the selected champion three out of four years.  That's pretty fortunate, to be honest.

We begin planning before Worlds, yes. However, we're not planning these skins at the beginning of the spring split. The skin itself takes around two months to create, including the preliminary brainstorming and nailing down the concept.
They have to Brainstorm ideas and plan what the want the skin to look like to ensure it's an original looking skin. They also have other skins they have to think of and create.

So are the victorious and championship skins are in the same criteria? Or is it through pick/ban rates or through performance rating? I feel like most of the victorious and championship skins are after they were nerfed (which sucks but I get it) but to remember their legacy of being a terror at one point.

The criteria is similar, yes. We're looking for impactful champions throughout the season, both in competitive play, as well as solo queue. We're less concerned about bans because it means those champions aren't getting played. While they may be terrors,  they're not terrors on the Rift if they're not played.

But isnt the biggest way of being impactful by being so good/strong that you have to get banned out? it seems kind of silly to give the skin to someone who is mid tier becuase high tier was banned out.

So, in other words, this is the skin for the champion that Riot was bad at balancing?

Man, can't wait for all of my favorite champs to get this skin oh wait Anivia hasn't been touched in years WELP.
